After the gunman fired the shots, he barricaded himself in the office and police at the scene returned fire. Nobody was injured. The gunman surrendered in the office and was apprehended. Children had to leave the building and were being guided to a corner of a field, where they were picked up by their parents. The alleged gunman is a 20-year-old male named Michael Brandon Hill.

properties.title: Langston Hughes High School
properties.description: After a homecoming football game, a fatal shooting of Kristofer Hunter, 17, occurred in the Langston Hughes High School parking lot. The assailant, Eric Dana Johnson Jr., 18, turned himself in a week later.

properties.title: Harlem High
properties.description: Edward Bryant Gillom, a freshman at Harlem High School, shot two fellow students, killing 15-year-old Ronrecas Gibson.

properties.title: Banks County High
properties.description: A 16-year-old student at Banks County High School fatally shot himself in a school restroom.

properties.title: Parkview High School
properties.description: A 16-year-old student, David Egan, was beaten in the locker room of

properties.title: Stephenson High
properties.description: A Stephenson High School student and a janitor were shot in an apparent confrontation between team members and a group of teens who don't attend the school. Both were innocent bystanders in the ordeal.

properties.title: DeRenne Middle School
properties.description: A 13-year-old female student was stabbed by another female student at DeRenne Middle School. She was hospitalized for non-life-threatening injuries to the head, shoulder and right arm. The suspect was charged with aggravated assault, possession of a weapon on school property and disrupting public school.

properties.title: DeKalb Alternative School.
properties.description: David Dubose Jr. shot and killed 49-year-old English teacher Horace P. Morgan with a .38 caliber revolver in a corridor of DeKalb Alternative School. Dubose was then subdued by staff members.

properties.title: President Theodore Roosevelt High School
properties.description: A 17-year-old boy was shot in the wrist after attacking police officers with a kitchen knife at

properties.title: Highlands Intermediate
properties.description: A 14-year-old student is accused of firing a handgun on the campus of Highlands Intermediate School, wounding one student. The gunman was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder. Two other suspects were arrested in connection with the shooting.

properties.title: Southeast Polk High
properties.description: While students in a French class at Southeast Polk High School were taking a test in the hallway, a 17-year-old male student shot and killed a 16-year-old female student before killing himself.

properties.title: North High School
properties.description: After a basketball game at

properties.title: River Woods Elementary
properties.description: An 11-year-old student at RWES in Des Moines, Iowa, brought a BB gun to the school accompanied by two former students aged 11 & 16. The student admitted to having the weapon and making threats against 4 students. Police recovered the gun and arrested the alleged students.

properties.title: Aplington-Parkersburg High
properties.description: Mark Becker entered the weight room of Aplington-Parkersburg High School, in Parkersburg, Iowa, and shot football coach Ed Thomas inside. Thomas was airlifted to Covenant Medical Center in Waterloo, Iowa, where he later died of his wounds. Becker was arrested and charged with first-degree murder. Becker was sentenced to life in prison without the possibility of parole.

properties.title: Notus Jr. Sr. High
properties.description: Shawn Cooper, 15, fired two shots from a 12 gauge shotgun, in the hall near the front desk at Notus Jr. Sr. High School. There were no serious injuries, but some students were close enough to the blast to catch some shrapnel from the tile floor. Shawn Cooper had been undergoing treatment for bipolar disorder.

properties.title: Aledo High
properties.description: 26-year-old track coach George Marich was stabbed to death by 17-year-old student James Gipson in a hallway of Aledo High School. The stabbing occurred after Marich had removed Gipson and two other seniors from a study hall for creating a disturbance.

properties.title: Bloomington High School
properties.description: Andrew Lyons, 15, sent messages electronically at approximately 11:17 A.M., asking people to help him carry out a Columbine-style shooting at Bloomington High School, but was arrested by police at about 3:06 P.M. and was questioned and his person and home was searched for weapons and possible links to his statements. Nothing was found, and no charges were filed as of February 21. He also agreed to seek help at Streamwood Behavioral Healthcare for possible mental illness and was released on January 18. No shooting, injures, or deaths took place as a result of his statements.

properties.title: Camargo
properties.description: Teacher Fletcher R. Barnett shot and killed another teacher, Eva C. Wiseman, in front of her class at a school. After shooting at a pupil who came to help Miss Wiseman and wounding himself in a failed suicide attempt, he waited in the classroom until a group of farmers came to lynch him. He then ran out of the school building, grabbed a shotgun from one of the farmers and shot himself, before running away and leaping into a well where he finally drowned. The incident was likely sparked by Wiseman's refusal to marry Barnett.

properties.title: Rebound High School
properties.description: A group of students at Rebound High School got in an argument in the school's parking lot. One student pulled out a gun and shot another student in the ensuing altercation. An 18-year-old suspect is facing charges of attempted murder.

properties.title: Carmi
properties.description: George Nicholson shot and killed John Kurd at a schoolhouse during a school rehearsal. The motive for the shooting was Kurd making a disparaging remark about Nicholson's daughter during her recital.

properties.title: Barton Elementary
properties.description: Elementary school principal Rudolph Jezek, Jr., 52, was shot to death in his office by Steven Guy, 14, a former student said to be angry at being transferred from the school to a social adjustment center.

properties.title: Dunbar High
properties.description: Five male teenagers leaving a basketball game held on the campus of Dunbar Vocational Career Academy, in the South Side area of Chicago, Illinois, received gunshot wounds after shots were fired from a passing vehicle. All five victims were sent to Chicago area hospitals, three of whom were treated for serious injuries. Police arrested 18-year-old Georgio Dukes a week after the shooting on five counts of aggravated battery with a firearm.

properties.title: Harlan Comm Academy High
properties.description: At Harlan Community Academy High School, a fight broke between two 15-year-old boys in the gymnasium. One of the boys took out a .25-caliber pistol and shot the other one in the leg. A police officer on duty at the school arrested the gunman.

properties.title: Kelly High
properties.description: Patrick Colletta, 14, was shot to death by Bernice Turner,14, in a classroom of Kelly High School. It was reported that after Turner refused to date Colletta he handed her the gun and dared her to pull the trigger, telling her that the gun was “only a toy.” A coroner’s jury later ruled that the shooting was an accident.

properties.title: Lewis-Champlin Elementary
properties.description: Teacher Josephine Keane, 45, is sexually assaulted and stabbed to death inside a storeroom at Lewis-Champlin elementary school in Chicago. Lee Arthur Hester, a 14-year-old student, is later convicted of the murder and sentenced to 55 years in prison.

properties.title: Montefiore Special Elementary
properties.description: Armed with a .38 caliber pistol, 40-year-old Clemmie Henderson shot two people dead at an auto parts store and wounded a garbage man before entering Montefiore Special Elementary School where he killed a school custodian and a police officer. He wounded another police officer before he was shot and killed.

properties.title: Tilden High
properties.description: Shooting in a second floor hallway near a science classroom at Edward Tilden High School, a dispute over the winnings of a dice game led to Delondyn Lawson's death, even though he wasn't involved in the dispute, just in the right place at the wrong time. Joe White, 15, and another student were arguing about the payoff when one of the students punched Joe in the mouth. Joe pulled out a .22-caliber handgun and opened fire on the group. Delondyn, 15, was shot twice in the back and two more classmates, 17-year-old Wilson Ching and 15-year-old Barron Hall were wounded. In the flight to flee the scene, a third student was hit by a car and also taken to the hospital. Joe was arrested a short time later.

properties.title: Thornridge High
properties.description: A 14-year-old student shot and wounded his math teacher at Thornridge High School.

properties.title: Ombudsman Education Center
properties.description: A masked gunman shot and killed 14-year-old Hugo Rodriguez at the Ombudsman Education Services alternative education center. It was reported that police thought this shooting to be gang-related. Rickey L. Quezada was later arrested for the crime and convicted of first-degree murder.

properties.title: Elmwood Park Comm High
properties.description: Elmwood Park Community High School student Cynthia Schulze was shot and killed in the hallway between classes by student William Rossi, with whom she was probably not acquainted. Rossi then ran out of the school and shot himself to death in an alley nearby.

properties.title: Lawrenceville High
properties.description: After Georgine Lyon, 25, ended her engagement with Charles Petrach, Petrach shot and killed Lyon in a classroom at Lawrenceville High School where she worked as a librarian.

properties.title: Normal Comm High
properties.description: A student fired multiple gunshots in the ceiling of Normal Community High School, and was tackled by a teacher. Nobody was injured. A 14-year-old student was arrested and is charged with 16 felony counts.

properties.title: Boylan Central Catholic High
properties.description: Michael Graham, a 15-year-old student at Boylan Central Catholic High School, shot and wounded his German teacher, Sharon Mundt, who had previously disciplined him for misbehavior, in front of his class.

properties.title: Warrenville
properties.description: Sylvester E. Adams shot and killed teacher Edith Smith after she rejected his advances. Adams then shot and killed himself. The incident took place in a schoolhouse about a mile outside of Warrenville after the students had been dismissed for the day.

properties.title: Hubbard Woods Elementary
properties.description: Laurie Dann walked into a second grade classroom at Hubbard Woods Elementary School carrying a pistol and two revolvers and began shooting children, killing eight-year-old Nicholas Corwin and wounding five others before fleeing. She entered a nearby house where she had shot and wounded a 20-year-old man before killing herself.

properties.title: Brownstown Central High
properties.description: Jessie Blevins, 48, athletic director at Brownstown Central High School, was shot to death in the school parking lot by a 17-year-old student.

properties.title: Lew Wallace High
properties.description: Donald Ray Burt Jr., a 17-year-old expelled student, shot and killed 16-year-old student Neal Boyd III in the parking lot of Lew Wallace High School, in Gary, Indiana.

properties.title: Saint Mary School
properties.description: A man fatally shot his estranged wife in the parking lot of Saint Mary School in northwestern Indiana and later killed himself at his home after a police officer confronted him.

properties.title: William Reed Elementary
properties.description: Principal Leonard Redden shot and killed two teachers with a shotgun at William Reed Elementary School in Hartford City, Indiana, before fleeing into a remote forest, where he committed suicide.

properties.title: Arlington High
properties.description: 17-year-old Bertram Bowman is stabbed to death in the cafeteria of Arlington High School, reportedly in a dispute over a girl. Police arrested 15-year-old Edward C. Ector after the attack.

properties.title: Martinsville West Middle
properties.description: Michael Phelps, a 15-year-old suspended student, returned to Martinsville West Middle School with a 9mm handgun. In the entrance of the school, Phelps encountered 15-year-old Chance Jackson and shot him twice in the abdomen. Phelps fled the school and dropped the handgun in a field and was arrested shortly after.

properties.title: Penn High
properties.description: 16-year old Russell Frantom was arrested after notebook retrieved from his locker at Penn High School stated "I wanna break the current shooting record. I wanna get instant recognition." He and a 33 year old possible accomplice, Lee Billi, were charged with conspiracy. Lee Billi was sentenced to 10 years in prison on March 26, 2009

properties.title: Goddard Jr High
properties.description: James Alan Kearbey, 14, armed with a M1-A semiautomatic rifle and a .357-caliber handgun, killed principal Joseph McGee and wounded two teachers and a student at Goddard Junior High School.

properties.title: Topeka West High
properties.description: 20-year-old Matthew C. Mitchell was shot to death on the grounds of Topeka West High School during a drug deal. A 17-year-old male was injured from five gunshot wounds. Police arrested three suspects.

properties.title: East Carter High
properties.description: Scott Pennington, 17, fatally shot his teacher, Deanna McDavid, and head custodian Marvin Hicks at East Carter High School.

properties.title: Fern Creek Traditional High School
properties.description: One student was shot and injured at

properties.title: Ryle High
properties.description: Clay Shrout kills his mother, father, and two younger sisters before embarking a hostage situation in a trigonometry classroom.

properties.title: Heath High
properties.description: Three students were killed and five wounded by Michael Carneal, 14, as they participated in a prayer circle. Carneal was sentenced to life in prison.

properties.title: Jena High School
properties.description: A fight broke out on campus, after which six African-American students, later dubbed the Jena 6, were arrested and charged with attempted second-degree murder. Racial tensions are believed to have been the cause of this incident.

properties.title: Larose-Cut Off Middle
properties.description: Justin Doucet, a 15-year-old eighth grade student, fired one shot from a .25-caliber semi-automatic pistol above a teacher's head inside her classroom at Larose-Cut Off Middle School, in Larose, Louisiana, and then entered a restroom next door and shot himself through the chin.

properties.title: McDonogh High
properties.description: Two men killed 15-year-old student Jonathan "Caveman" Williams at John McDonogh High School.

properties.title: East St. John High
properties.description: 19-year-old senior Debbie Morantes is stabbed to death by 16-year-old sophomore Brenda Carter inside the cafeteria of East St. John High School. Brenda Carter was convicted of second-degree murder two years later.

properties.title: Boyet Jr High
properties.description: 13-year-old gifted Boyet Junior High School student Matt Cooper shot himself in class with a .45-caliber pistol.

properties.title: Cambridge Rindge and Latin School
properties.description: A 19-year-old student stabbed another student in the shoulder with a steak knife during a fight at

properties.title: Northfield Mount Hermon
properties.description: Headmaster Elliott Speer was murdered by a shotgun blast through the window of his study at Northfield Mount Hermon School. The crime was never solved

properties.title: Wire Village School
properties.description: A 7-year-old student was stabbed by another 7-year-old student at Wire Village School. The victim was hospitalized for serious but non-life-threatening injuries.

properties.title: Lincoln-Sudbury Regional High
properties.description: 15-year-old James Alenson was stabbed to death with a knife in the Lincoln-Sudbury Regional High School washroom in the East House section by 16-year old John Odgren. Odgren did not know Alenson, and he chose to stab him at random.

properties.title: Friendship Academy of Science and Technology
properties.description: A 14-year-old student was stabbed in the chest at Friendship Academy of Science and Technology during an altercation with another student. A 17-year-old, Sharrod Alston, was charged with first and second-degree assault, disorderly conduct and possession with a deadly weapon.

properties.title: Lemmel Middle
properties.description: 15-year-old Markel Williams was stabbed to death on the grounds of William H. Lemmel Middle School, during school hours. 14-year-old Timothy Oxendine was tried as an adult and was convicted of first-degree murder.

properties.title: Frederick High School
properties.description: Two students were shot outside Frederick High School near the gymnasium of

properties.title: Perry Hall High
properties.description: Robert Gladden, 15, took a double barrel shotgun to Perry Hall High School and fired shots inside the school cafeteria. A 17-year-old senior was hit in the lower back while he was sitting at a table and suffered critical wounds. Gladden was immediately subdued by two school faculty members, and was arrested.

properties.title: Maryland Park Jr High
properties.description: 15-year-old student Billy Prevatte fatally shot one teacher and injured two others at Maryland Park Junior High School in Prince George's County after he had been reprimanded from the school.

properties.title: Randallstown High
properties.description: When a fistfight in the parking lot at Randallstown High School turned into a brawl that Matthew McCullough and his friends were losing, Tyrone Brown pulled a gun. He fired several rounds before handing the weapon to McCullough, who then began shooting. McCullough emptied the gun of its remaining bullets into the fleeing crowd. Four students were injured.

properties.title: Gray-New Gloucester High
properties.description: Gaige McGue, 19, of Denmark died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the parking lot of Gray-New Gloucester High School during homecoming weekend. According to the sheriff’s office, McCue had never been a student at the school.

properties.title: Stockton Springs Elementary
properties.description: Eleven fifth-grade students were taken hostage in a classroom at Stockton Springs Elementary School, in Stockton Springs, Maine. The hostage situation ended within 30 minutes when the gunman surrendered to a state trooper. The hostage taker, 55-year-old Randall Hofland, was wanted by authorities for pointing a handgun at an officer during a traffic stop and then fleeing.

properties.title: Bath Consolidated School
properties.description: School treasurer Andrew Kehoe, after killing his wife and destroying his house and farm, blew up the Bath Consolidated School by detonating dynamite in the basement of the school, killing 45 people, mostly children. He then pulled up to the school in his car, then set off a bomb, killing himself and four others. This remains the deadliest mass murder at a school in United States history.

properties.title: Caro Learning Center
properties.description: 17-year old Chris Buschbacher, armed with a .22-caliber rifle and a 20-gauge shotgun, took one teacher and one student hostage at the Caro Learning Center before killing himself.

properties.title: Chelsea High
properties.description: High school teacher Steven Leith walked out of a staff meeting, returned with a gun, fatally shot the school district's superintendent and wounded the principal and a teacher.

properties.title: Burt Elementary
properties.description: English teacher Betty McCaster, 46, was shot to death by her estranged husband in front of her first grade class at Burt Elementary School in northwest Detroit.

properties.title: East English Village Preparatory Academy
properties.description: After a Friday evening student awards ceremony called "Grammy Night", four men who were affiliated with a gang fired into a crowd in the parking lot of

properties.title: Henry Ford High
properties.description: Christopher Walker, 16, was killed, and three other teenagers were seriously wounded during a drive-by shooting at a primary school lawn adjacent to Henry Ford High School, where Walker and the other students were just dismissed from after classes ended.

properties.title: Mumford High
properties.description: Two students were shot and wounded in front of Mumford High School. A 17-year-old man, Steven Jamal Hare, was tried as an adult and charged with assault with intent to kill.

properties.title: Murray Wright High
properties.description: A ninth-grade Murray Wright High School student killed Chester Jackson, 17, and wounded Damon Matthews, 17, and Tomeka Turner, 18.

properties.title: Murray-Wright High
properties.description: Intruders shot five Murray-Wright High School students after an apparent dispute over one of the intruders girlfriends.

properties.title: Northwestern High
properties.description: During halftime of the homecoming football game between Northwestern High School and Murray-Wright High School, a boy who was in a fight earlier that day pulled out a shotgun and opened fire, injuring six students.

properties.title: Osborn High
properties.description: A 16-year-old boy was shot in a field across the school campus after a basketball game was held at Osborn High School. He was hospitalized in serious condition.

properties.title: Precious Blood School
properties.description: Kelly Crittendon, 13, was accidentally shot to death in a classroom at the Precious Blood School by two classmates.

properties.title: Buell Elementary
properties.description: At Buell Elementary School, 6-year-old Dedrick Owens, the youngest-ever school shooter, shot and killed classmate Kayla Rolland in a stairwell before he was taken into police custody..

properties.title: Everett High
properties.description: Roger Needham, a 15-year-old student, shot two students at Everett High School. One of the students, 15-year-old Bill Draher, died of his gunshot wound.

properties.title: J.W. Sexton High
properties.description: Three students and one other teenager were shot outside of J.W. Sexton High School, at about 2:45 PM. Apparently, a group of students went to a location near the school and were attempting to settle some type of disagreement, when shots rang out. The three injured students were hospitalized while an additional teenager later showed up at an area hospital who was injured as well.

properties.title: Rentschler
properties.description: Teacher Irma Caler was shot and killed in her classroom at Rentschler school by 19-year-old Robert Warner, apparently because she had rejected his advances.

properties.title: Henry Dow High
properties.description: 17-year old David Turner shot and critically wounded 17-year old Jessica Forsyth four times outside Herbert Henry Dow High School before killing himself in the parking lot.

properties.title: Owosso High
properties.description: James Pouillon, 63, was killed in a drive-by shooting in front of Owosso High School, in Michigan, where he was protesting against abortion. Several students witnessed the attack but none were injured. An hour later the body of business owner Mike Fuoss was found shot to death inside his office at Fuoss Gravel. Police arrested Harlan James Drake after the shootings and charged him with two counts of first-degree murder.

properties.title: Holland Woods Middle
properties.description: A 12-year-old, 13-year-old and two 14-year-olds, all boys, planned to outdo Eric Harris and Dylan Klebold at Columbine massacre. They planned to hold up a gun store and then attack the school. Once there, they planned to rape some of the girls and shoot as many as 154 targets which they had drawn up on a list. They had stolen a building plan from the custodian's office but they were all caught within a day of a classmate's report to an assistant principal.

properties.title: Spring Lake Park Elementary
properties.description: Lester Betts, a 40-year-old mail-carrier, walked into the office of 33-year-old principal Carson Hammond and shot him to death with a 12-gauge shotgun.

properties.title: Rocori High
properties.description: 15-year-old Jason McLaughlin shot Aaron Rollins and Seth Bartell at Rocori High School with a .22- caliber pistol. Rollins died the same day; Bartell died October 10 of injuries sustained in the attack

properties.title: Cook County High
properties.description: 17-year-old David Riehm was arrested at his home after authorities at Cook County High School turned over a collection of writings and essays to police in which Riehm described in great detail shooting and killing his English teacher. He was later acquitted of all charges.

properties.title: Grand Rapids High
properties.description: Grand Rapids High School student David Black, 15, killed school administrator Forrest Willey and seriously wounded fellow student Kevin Roth, 14

properties.title: Red Lake Sr. High
properties.description: Jeffrey Weise, a student at Red Lake High School in Red Lake, Minnesota, killed his grandfather and his grandfather's girlfriend before killing seven more people: five students, a teacher, and an unarmed security guard at Red Lake High School. The attack concluded when Weise exchanged fire with police, and then retreated to a classroom where he fatally shot himself.

properties.title: De Kalb Elementary
properties.description: After constant teasing and humiliation about his weight, Nathan Ferris armed himself with a pistol and killed a fellow student after he bullied him in class. He then turned the gun on himself.

properties.title: McCluer North High
properties.description: 15-year-old Christine Smetzer is raped and beaten to death inside a washroom at McCluer North High School. Her attacker, Michael Taylor, is later sentenced to life imprisonment for the murder.

properties.title: Memorial Middle School
properties.description: Thomas White, a 13-year-old student fired a cheap imitation AK-47 inside his middle school after confronting two others students and his principal. The student was wearing a mask and had pointed the gun at the principal, the assistant superintendent and two students. After firing a shot into the ceiling and breaking a water pipe, the student's gun jammed when he attempted to fire additional shots.

properties.title: Mountain Park Baptist Academy
properties.description: 16-year-old student Will Futrelle was killed by an 18-year old and two 15-year old students at Mountain Park Baptist Academy.

properties.title: Parkway South Jr High
properties.description: 14-year old David F. Lawler brings two family owned pistols to school in a blue duffel bag and opens fire on two classmates at 11:55 a.m., killing one and injuring the other. He turns one of the guns on himself and takes his own life.

properties.title: Pershing Elementary School
properties.description: Police said one person has been arrested for a shooting at Pershing Elementary School in University City. The shooting occurred in the parking lot, with a 34-year-old-man being shot in the buttocks.

properties.title: Wingfield High
properties.description: Faye Williams, 17, was shot to death in her algebra classroom at Wingfield High School by her ex-boyfriend, James Hartzog, 18. Hartzog then killed himself.

properties.title: Pearl High
properties.description: Luke Woodham, 16, murdered his mother at home before killing his ex-girlfriend and another student and wounding seven others at Pearl High School. The perpetrator attempted to flee police and continue his killing spree at a nearby middle school, but he was stopped and detained by the Vice Principal.

properties.title: North Panola High School
properties.description: A student, Roderick Bobo, 15, was shot during a football game at North Panola High School in what was termed as a gang-related shooting. Two others were injured in the shooting, and three men were charged as being responsible for the crime.

properties.title: Leary Elementary
properties.description: An 11-year-old boy died Wednesday, a day after being shot in the head by a classmate on a crowded elementary school playground,

properties.title: Fergus High
properties.description: 14-year old Kristofer Hans, angry over a failing grade, shoots and kills a substitute teacher for a French classroom, and then later wounded a vice principal and two students.

properties.title: Albemarle High School
properties.description: Two students got in an argument at

properties.title: Girls School
properties.description: Dr. C. O. Swinney shot and fatally wounded his 16-year-old daughter Nellie in a reception room at Normal and Collegiate Institute. He then committed suicide by shooting himself in the head.

properties.title: Cape Fear High
properties.description: A 15-year-old girl was shot in the neck at Cape Fear High School. A .22-caliber rifle was used in the attack. A student of the school,15-year-old Charles Underwood, was arrested and charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: Pine Forest High
properties.description: a 17-year-old student opened fire at Pine Forest High School, injuring three other students.

properties.title: Westover High
properties.description: A 15-year-old male was struck in the foot with a bullet at a parking lot of Westover High School, in Fayetteville, North Carolina. The shooting occurred when 19-year-old Terrance Donnell Johnson, Jr. fired several shots from a handgun at his opponents during a fashion show held at the school.

properties.title: J.B. Martin Middle School
properties.description: A police officer was shot outside a school in a school zone while he was directing school buses into a school. The school was J.B. Martin Middle School, and the suspect was apprehended at the scene.

properties.title: Grimsley High
properties.description: Nicholas Atkinson, a 16-year old Grimsley High School student, returned to campus after being suspended. He proceeded to shoot and wound the assistant principal with a 9 mm handgun before committing suicide.

properties.title: D. H. Conley High School
properties.description: Just after the lunch hour, at D. H. Conley High School, a car drove past the school and witnesses said an occupant reached out of a car window and fired shots in the direction of the school. This incident occurred on Worthington and Tull Roads, directly in front of the school. No one was injured. Two 17 year old students were arrested the next day after firing a handgun from a moving vehicle in the direction of the school. No students or teachers were injured.

properties.title: Orange High
properties.description: 19-year-old Alvaro Rafael Castillo opened fire at Orange High School with a rifle and shotgun, shooting eight times and wounding two students. Officers ordered him to stop firing and he immediately complied. Castillo killed his father with a firearm before driving to school in a van.

properties.title: North Mecklenberg High
properties.description: A 16-year-old threatened two students in the parking lot at North Mecklenberg High School with a gun, and shortly afterwards, had shot himself at a local gas station when confronted by police.

properties.title: Salisbury High School
properties.description: 17 year old suspect was charged with assault with a deadly weapon with intent to kill inflicting serious injury, possession of a firearm on school property and discharging a weapon on school property.

properties.title: Salisbury High School
properties.description: A 16-year-old student was shot in the stomach on the campus of

properties.title: Carver High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot in the neck and shoulder at Carver High School. The victim was hospitalized with non-life threatening injuries. An 18-year-old student was apprehended by a school resource officer without incident.

properties.title: Carver High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot in the neck and shoulder at

properties.title: Fairmount High
properties.description: A freshman of Fairmount Public School shot himself in the head with a handgun in front of his classmates in a classroom.

properties.title: Pius X High School
properties.description: A female student was stabbed and injured in the restroom of Pius X High School. Sarah Piccolo was arrested and is tried as an adult with first-degree aggravated assault and use of a deadly weapon.

properties.title: Malcolm High
properties.description: 17-year-old Joshua Magee was arrested in the parking lot of Malcolm High School after a school staff member, who saw the youth drinking liquor and putting on a black overcoat, called police. A search of Magee's car produced a bolt-action rifle, 20 bombs and a note stating that he wanted to injure everyone at the school except for three friends. Magee, to whom the school paid close attention after it was reported to faculty that he was experimenting with explosives at home, was charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: Millard South High
properties.description: Student Robert Butler Jr., 18, shot and killed Assistant Principal Dr. Vicki Kaspar, and wounded Principal Curtis Case. Butler then opened fire indiscriminately in the front office area, causing the school nurse to be injured by gunshot debris. Butler drove to a parking lot and then fatally shot himself.

properties.title: Walpole Elementary
properties.description: 14-year-old Hunter Mack shot himself in the face in the Walpole Elementary School school cafeteria filled with dozens of students eating lunch, no one else was injured.

properties.title: Cumberland Regional High
properties.description: 16-year-old student Nielsa Mason is beaten to death by fellow student Peter Henriques inside the boys’ locker room at Cumberland Regional High School.

properties.title: Mount Vernon Elementary
properties.description: Three Delaware State University students were forced to kneel against an elementary school wall and were shot execution-style by 28-year old Jose Carranza and two 15-year old juveniles. A fourth student was found with gunshot wounds to her head.

properties.title: St. James Elementary
properties.description: David Gary walked into a second grade classroom of St. James Elementary School where he shot and injured 25-year-old teacher Kathleen Flynn. He then killed the school principal, 38-year-old Rev. Thomas J. Quinlan, when he came to investigate.

properties.title: Carlsbad Mid-High
properties.description: Michael O'Hearn barricaded himself in a storage tower of Carlsbad Mid-High School, in Carlsbad, New Mexico, for about two hours with two firearms. He fired about two dozen rounds at police officers, injuring one, before committing suicide

properties.title: Deming Middle
properties.description: A 13-year-old girl fatally shot at Deming Middle School by Victor Cordova Jr., 13. Cordova stated he had intended to commit suicide but was jostled by others and the gun moved.

properties.title: Berrendo Middle School
properties.description: Two people were shot and wounded inside the gymnasium of Berrendo Middle School, at about 8:10 am. An 11-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl were airlifted to a hospital in

properties.title: Eldorado High
properties.description: Curtis Collins, a sophomore at Eldorado High School, shot and killed 16-year-old Donnie Lee Bolden inside the school cafeteria. Police said that the shooting was gang-related.

properties.title: Valley High
properties.description: 17-year-old Valley High School student Patrick Lizotte shot and killed his teacher Clarence Pigott and wounded two students.

properties.title: Canyon Springs High
properties.description: Three victims were at a senior breakfast at Canyon Springs High School when they were struck numerous times with a gun and robbed by a group of six people. Police arrested Nicholas Johnson and Katario Miller, both 19, along with a juvenile. They are looking for three other suspects.

properties.title: Pine Middle
properties.description: 14-year-old student James Newman brought a .38-caliber revolver to Pine Middle School in Reno, Nevada, and shot and injured two students at random in the school's hallway before being restrained by a physical education teacher.

properties.title: Sparks Middle
properties.description: 12-year-old seventh-grade student Jose Reyes opened fire with a semi-automatic handgun at the basketball courts of Sparks Middle School, injuring one student in the shoulder. A teacher, Michael Landsberry, who was trying to intervene with the gunman was then shot and killed. Reyes shot and wounded a student who tried to come to Landsberry's assistance after he fell onto the ground. Reyes then committed suicide by shooting himself in the head.

properties.title: Amityville High
properties.description: Shem S. McCoy, 17, shot two people, both cousins of his, at Amityville High School. One of those shot, Randel Artis, would die of his gunshot injuries. The three boys had apparently been engaged in a long running dispute.

properties.title: Bay Shore Sr High
properties.description: Teacher John S. Lane, 48, was shot and fatally wounded when he tried to stop 16-year-old student James Arthur Frampton, who was walking through the halls of Bay Shore Senior High School with a shotgun, searching for some boys with whom he had an argument earlier that day. Lane died of his wounds on June 13, 1966.

properties.title: Binghamton High
properties.description: A brawl broke out among the students of Binghamton High School. It started as a food fight-prank in the cafeteria, then radiated out into the streets. Some police officers and school personnel suffered minor injuries, and at least one school administrator suffered more serious injuries. Over 100 students then gathered at Oak and Main streets and the situation rapidly degraded. Police broke up the incident.

properties.title: Canandaigua Academy
properties.description: A 17-year-old senior shot and killed himself in a bathroom at Canandaigua Academy in Canandaigua, New York. He had 30 rounds of ammunition and two explosive devices in his locker. Police said Thomas Kane used a sawed-off shotgun and died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound but did not use the Molotov cocktail-type devices, two glass bottles filled with liquid and rags, that were in his locker.

properties.title: Columbia High
properties.description: Jon W. Romano in East Greenbush, New York fired two rounds from a shotgun loaded with bird shot, wounding one teacher. He was tackled by the assistant principal and charged with one count of attempted murder.

properties.title: Southside High
properties.description: Jeremy Getman, 18, planned a school attack at Southside High School but it was foiled after students told a teacher that he was carrying weapons. He carried 14 pipe bombs, three smaller bombs, a propane tank, a sawed-off shotgun, and a .22 caliber pistol into the school by a duffel bag and also a book bag full of ammunition. On December 17, 2001, he was sentenced to 8½ years.

properties.title: Alverta B. Gray Schultz Middle School
properties.description: An adult and a juvenile were arrested in connection with an alleged attack on a middle school math teacher that sent the victim to the hospital. Annika McKenzie, 34, allegedly breached school security, waited outside a classroom and put the teacher in a headlock before several students punched and kicked the teacher. McKenzie alleges the teacher

properties.title: Massapequa High
properties.description: 15-year-old freshman Timothy Wall is shot to death by fellow classmate Bruce Zator in a washroom of Massapequa High School.

properties.title: Monroe-Woodbury High
properties.description: A 15-year-old boy from Monroe was already on juvenile probation when he broke down crying as he admitted he stockpiled bottles of gasoline, makeshift fuses, a torch, a 2-foot (0.61 m) machete and three tanks of propane in a plot to attack former fellow students at Monroe-Woodbury High School

properties.title: Mount Vernon High
properties.description: 17-year-old Shebule Jackson is stabbed to death by fellow student Hopeton Minott in a corridor of Mount Vernon High School.

properties.title: MLK Jr High
properties.description: 17-year-old Vincent Rodriguez shot and wounded two students at Martin Luther King, Jr. High School in Manhattan, New York City, with a .380-caliber semi-automatic pistol. The possible motive was that the victims had harassed Rodriguez's girlfriend. In February 2003, Rodriguez was sentenced to 10 years in prison on charges of assault and attempted assault.

properties.title: Bronx High
properties.description: 18-year-old Henry Smith, a student at a Bronx vocational high school, is stabbed to death by 16-year-old Randolph Lawrence, a fellow student. The stabbing was reportedly sparked over a dispute about a basketball game.

properties.title: Brooklyn
properties.description: A 14-year-old student was fatally wounded by a shot from the .22 caliber rifle of a fellow student Robert Ross, 17. The youth was accidentally shot in the head when he chanced into range where Ross was target shooting near a lake on the school property.

properties.title: Bushwick High
properties.description: While changing a tire on a teacher’s car outside Bushwick High School, 18-year-old Joseph Gallo Rodriguez was accosted by two men looking to rob him of a silver crucifix. When he refused the robbers shot him and fled. Rodriguez died of the gunshot wound the next day.

properties.title: Canarsie High
properties.description: 12-year-old Anthony Haynes is stabbed to death in the cafeteria of Canarsie High School. Two 16-year-old students were arrested for the crime. It was suspected that the stabbing was gang-related.

properties.title: Dwight School for Girls
properties.description: Infuriated by a grievance, Matthew Gillespie, 62-year-old janitor at the junior school of the Dwight School for Girls, shot and critically wounded Mrs. Marshall Coxe, secretary of the junior school.

properties.title: Erasmus Hall High
properties.description: A student at Erasmus Hall High School was critically injured after being stabbed in the head repeatedly with a pair of scissors. A 16-year-old student was arrested and charged with attempted murder.

properties.title: Gaynor Jr. High
properties.description: Joseph Annunziata and Neil Simonelli shot and killed teacher Irwin Goodman at William J. Gaynor Junior High School after he had caught them smoking in a wash room. Neither Annunziata nor Simonelli was a student at the school.

properties.title: Harlem PS 119
properties.description: Nine-year-old Margaret Patton was attacked and killed at PS 119 in Harlem by two fellow students. One student held Patton's arms while the other stabbed her to death. Police later arrested 11-year-old Madeline Kirkland, who was charged with murder, and 13-year-old Eileen Foster, who was charged with juvenile delinquency

properties.title: John Adams High
properties.description: Michael Kittrell, 15, is stabbed to death by another student at John Adams High School.

properties.title: Jr High School 25
properties.description: 15-year-old Angel Jimenez is stabbed to death by another 15-year-old student in a hallway of Junior High School 25. The stabbing was sparked by a dispute between the two boys over who owned a pair of sunglasses.

properties.title: Monroe High
properties.description: 17-year-old Tryon Whittaker was shot to death by another youth outside of James Monroe High School in The Bronx. The boys had reportedly got into an argument and Whittaker challenged the other youth to a fight. The youth then walked away but returned with a gun and shot Whittaker.

properties.title: South Shore High
properties.description: Damion Ennis, 15, is stabbed to death by a fellow student in a hallway of South Shore High School.

properties.title: Olean High
properties.description: 17-year-old Anthony F. Barbaro, an honor student and member of the school's rifle team, indiscriminately shot at people on the street from windows at the third floor of the school building. Three people were killed and another 11 people were injured during the shooting.

properties.title: Jefferson Middle
properties.description: 13-year-old Stephne Givens was fatally stabbed at Jefferson Middle School by a fellow student.

properties.title: Valhalla Boarding School
properties.description: Angered by the refusal of his daughter, Melba Moshell, 15 years old, to leave a boarding school and return to his home, Joseph Moshell visited the school and shot and killed his daughter. He then shot himself in a failed suicide attempt.

properties.title: Bidwell Porter Elementary
properties.description: Frank Shoemaker shot and killed his estranged wife, 52-year-old Linda Shoemaker, in the parking lot of Bidwell Porter Elementary School where she worked as a cook. Frank Shoemaker then returned home and committed suicide.

properties.title: Chardon High
properties.description: Six students were shot at Chardon High School. One student, Daniel Parmentor, died at the scene, and on February 28, two other students, Russell King and Demetrius Hewlin, also died. The shooter, Thomas "T.J." Lane, was taken into police custody.

properties.title: Holy Name School
properties.description: 10-year-old Clarence Stevens, a third grade pupil at Holy Name School, was stabbed to death inside a storeroom at the school by 27-year-old Guy Willie Ponder.

properties.title: La Salle High
properties.description: A student shot himself at La Salle High School, a Catholic school. The student, Joe Poynter, was hospitalized in critical condition at a Cincinnati hospital. According to police, no known threats were made to any other students or staff. Police arrived immediately after the incident was reported.

properties.title: South Euclid
properties.description: Harry Smith shot and killed 22-year-old teacher Mary Shepard at South Euclid School after she had rejected him. Smith escaped and committed suicide in a barn near his home two hours later.

properties.title: Wilbur Wright High
properties.description: Thomas Prinz, a 21-year-old football coach at Wilbur Wright High School, is stabbed to death by 19-year-old Will Edward Dixon. The stabbing occurred when Prinz attempted to escort Dixon off the playing field. Dixon had been a student at the school but had dropped out after tenth grade.

properties.title: Charles F. Brush High School
properties.description: Five shots were fired in the parking lot of

properties.title: Notre Dame Elementary
properties.description: William Michael Layne, the estranged husband of a teacher at Notre Dame Elementary School, stabbed a bystander on the street prior to entering the school. He then walked into his wife's fifth grade classroom where he shot and stabbed her. Layne later shot and killed himself after a stand-off with police at his home.

properties.title: Stow High
properties.description: A 16-year-old student at Stow High School shot and wounded his chemistry teacher during an argument.

properties.title: Arlington
properties.description: 12-year-old Robert Snyder shot and wounded his principal, June Mapes, in her office at Arlington public school when she declined his request to call a classmate. He then fled the school grounds and shot and wounded himself.

properties.title: Wickliffe Middle
properties.description: Keith Ledeger, 37, a former student at Wickliffe Middle School, shot and killed custodian Pete Christopher and wounded four other adults.

properties.title: Fort Gibson Middle
properties.description: 13-year old Seth Trickey armed himself with a 9 mm semiautomatic handgun and opened fire of 15 rounds at Fort Gibson Middle School, injuring four classmates.

properties.title: Grove Elementary
properties.description: Principal T.J. Melton is shot to death by James Underwood, a school custodian.

properties.title: Douglass High
properties.description: A 14 year-old student shot a 17 year-old student to death in a Douglass High School hallway, prompting the installation of metal detectors in city schools.

properties.title: U.S. Grant High
properties.description: U.S. Grant High School student Randy Truitt was shot and killed by James Briggs at the school, leaving several others injured.[147]

properties.title: Stillwater Jr High
properties.description: Cade Poulos, 13, fataly shot himself in the head shortly before classes started at Stillwater Junior High School.

properties.title: Bend High School
properties.description: Police say a Bend High School student died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in the presence of classmates. The student brought the gun onto campus and fired the fatal shot Friday in a modular classroom. No one else was injured.

properties.title: Springwater Trail High
properties.description: High school freshman Chad Escobedo shoots the windows out of two classrooms from outside Springwater Trail High School injuring ten students with shrapnel and broken glass, two of which required stitches. His motive was to shoot at a class in which he was enrolled, unhappy that the instructor had called his parents; the classrooms he hit, however, were not his intended target.

properties.title: Rosemary Anderson High School
properties.description: On December 12, 2014, an unknown gunman shot three students and a man outside Rosemary Anderson High School in north Portland. A 16-year-old girl was in critical condition, while the others suffered minor injuries. An 18 year-old man was arrested in connection with the shooting.

properties.title: Crook County High
properties.description: An 18-year-old male student at Crook County High School died of a gunshot wound to the head in an apparent suicide in the school's parking lot.

properties.title: Roseburg High
properties.description: 14-year-old Vincent Leodoro shot 16-year-old fellow student Joseph Monti in the back four times with a 10mm semi-automatic pistol, critically injuring him, in the courtyard of Roseburg High School in Roseburg, Oregon.

properties.title: Thurston High
properties.description: After killing his parents at home, Kip Kinkel, 15, drove to Thurston High School where he shot and killed two students and wounded 25 others. He was sentenced to 111 years of prison.

properties.title: Reynolds High School
properties.description: At around 8:30 am, shots were fired at

properties.title: West Albany High School
properties.description: Grant Acord, a 17-year-old junior who was attending

properties.title: Brownsville Jr. High
properties.description: 16-year-old Ettra Cimagha is stabbed to death by 16-year-old Thomas Celestine during a fight at Brownsville Junior High School.

properties.title: St. Andrew School
properties.description: An eighth grade student who attended St. Andrew School in Drexel Hill was arrested after a fellow pupil he attempted to recruit for an attack tipped off authorities.

properties.title: Parker Middle
properties.description: Andrew Wurst, 14, fatally shot teacher John Gillette, 48, and wounded two students and a teacher at a Parker Middle School 8th grade graduation dance.

properties.title: West Nickel Mines School
properties.description: Charles Carl Roberts IV, a 32-year-old milk truck driver, shot to death five Amish girls and wounded five others before killing himself in an Amish school in the hamlet of Nickel Mines, in Bart Township, Lancaster County.

properties.title: Franklin Regional High School
properties.description: In the

properties.title: Delaware Valley Charter High School
properties.description: A student allegedly shot two other students in the gymnasium at Delaware Valley Charter School. Both victims, a male and a female, were shot in the arm. They were taken to a nearby hospital and are in stable condition, police say. Police Commissioner Charles Ramsey said at a news conference that the shooter ran out of the school after the shooting but was taken into custody near his home. 17-year-old Raisheem Rochwell was arrested and charged as an adult for aggravated assault, recklessly endangering another person and firearms offenses.

properties.title: Leeds Jr High
properties.description: Samson L. Freedman, a 56-year-old art teacher, was shot to death by Kevin Simmons at Leeds Junior High School. Freedman had previously got Simmons suspended from school for cursing in the hallway.

properties.title: Brashear High
properties.description: After classes ended, at least one gunman came out of the woods and opened fire on three students as they were walking to their cars at Brashear High School. One student was grazed in the head, another was struck in the neck and shoulder, and a third was hit in the leg and foot. Six people were taken into custody. The shooting is believed to be drug-related.

properties.title: Plymouth Whitemarsh High
properties.description: 14-year-old Dillon Cossey was arrested at his home in Plymouth Meeting after a friend told police about his plan to carry out a Columbine style attack on Plymouth Whitemarsh High School.

properties.title: Pottstown High
properties.description: 15-year-old Richard Yanis was arrested for plotting a school shooting at Pottstown High School after his father reported to police three missing handguns. An investigation revealed that Yanis had stolen the guns from his father and put them into a duffel bag, which he handed to a friend with the words to "hold onto it". After checking the bag Yanis' friend told his mother of the weapons, who then forced him to get rid of them by throwing them into a river.

properties.title: North Hopewell Winterstown Elementary
properties.description: William Stankewicz entered North Hopewell Winterstown Elementary School and brutally slashed two teachers and a principal with a machete. He then subsequently wounded several children in a kindergarten classroom before being subdued by a faculty member.

properties.title: Red Lion Area Jr High
properties.description: On April 24, 2003, eighth-grade student James Sheets entered Red Lion Area Junior High School armed with his stepfather's pistols and subsequently killed the school's principal, Eugene Segro, before killing himself.

properties.title: Wilson Southern Middle
properties.description: A 14-year-old male student stabbed another 14-year-old male student four times with a pocketknife at Wilson Southern Middle School. The assailant was arrested after fleeing from the school.

properties.title: Uniontown Elementary
properties.description: 29-year-old teacher Carolyn Dellamea is shot to death inside her third grade classroom by 35-year-old William Kuhns. Kuhns then shot himself in the chest in a failed suicide attempt. Kuhns had reportedly been courting Dellamea for over a year but the relationship was ended when Dellamea discovered that Kuhns was already married.

properties.title: Bishop Neumann High
properties.description: Elizabeth Catherine Bush, 14, wounded student Kimberly Marchese in the cafeteria of Bishop Neumann High School; she was depressed and frequently teased.

properties.title: West Franklin Elementary
properties.description: Principal Dennis Ray Hepler, 35, was accosted by three young men on the grounds of West Franklin Elementary School. They robbed him of $67 before shooting him to death. Two of the perpetrators were sentenced to death. The third was sentenced to 35 years in prison. A fourth man was convicted as an accessory for driving the three assailants away from the crime scene.

properties.title: Blackville-Hilda High
properties.description: Anthony Sincino, 16, killed one teacher and wounded another at Blackville-Hilda High School before committing suicide.

properties.title: Carolina Forest High
properties.description: Trevor Varinecz, a junior at Carolina Forest High School, attacked and stabbed police officer Marcus Rhodes, the School Resource Officer, inside his office. Rhodes then shot Varinecz in self defense. Varinecz later died in hospital.

properties.title: Greenville High
properties.description: Henry Chiariello, a 30-year-old social studies teacher, is stabbed to death at Greenville High School by 18-year-old student Jewel Garrett.

properties.title: Oakland Elementary
properties.description: James Wilson, 19, took a .22-caliber pistol to Oakland Elementary School where he shot and killed two students and injured seven other students and two teachers.

properties.title: Inman High
properties.description: Edward Foster, a 17-year-old student at Inman High school, was shot and fatally wounded by his teacher Reuben Pitts after he had jerked a rod from Pitts' hands to resist punishment. According to the teacher, Foster struck the pistol Pitts had drawn to defend himself, thus causing its discharge. Pitts was later acquitted of murder.

properties.title: Athens
properties.description: Student Ernest Powers fatally stabbed his teacher Elbert Wattanbarger when he attempted to whip him for throwing stones.

properties.title: Sullivan Central High
properties.description: Thomas Cowan entered Sullivan Central High School with two loaded guns with the intent on killing principal Melanie Riden. SRO Carolyn Gudger was able to hold him off until back-up arrived, when they were forced to shoot and kill Cowan. No staff or students were injured.

properties.title: Lincoln County High
properties.description: Three days before graduation, 18-year-old Jacob Davis shoots and kills a 17-year old student in the parking lot of his school after a dispute regarding his girlfriend.

properties.title: South Greene High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was stabbed and injured at

properties.title: Campbell County High
properties.description: After being confronted about bringing a gun on school property, 14-year old Kenneth Bartley opened fire on three school administrators at Campbell County High School, killing assistant principal Ken Bruce and critically wounding the principal and another assistant principal. The shooting was not premeditated.

properties.title: Liberty Technology Magnet High School
properties.description: A student was charged with bringing a gun to school at Liberty Technology Magnet High School and shooting a classmate in the thigh. The incident occurred outside the front of the school.

properties.title: Central High
properties.description: On August 21, 2008, 15-year-old student Jamar Siler entered the school cafeteria and approached student Ryan McDonald sitting at a lunch table. Siler fatally shot McDonald, and was shortly after arrested by authorities. The two had been in previous altercations, the details of which were not released to the general public. Siler was then taken into custody.

properties.title: Richland High
properties.description: James Rouse, 17, killed a student and teacher and seriously wounded another teacher at Richland High School with a .22 caliber rifle.

properties.title: Hamilton High
properties.description: Two Hamilton High School students were shot and wounded in the parking lot of the school. The attack was believed to be gang-related.

properties.title: Manassas High
properties.description: A Manassas High School student was accidentally shot in the arm by a friend during an honors English class when the friend's gun went off in his coat pocket. The student was treated and released.

properties.title: Memphis Jr Academy
properties.description: Suzette York, 49, the principal of Memphis Junior Academy, was stabbed to death in a classroom by 16-year-old student Eduardo Marmolejo. Marmolejo was tried as an adult and charged with second-degree murder.

properties.title: Mitchell High
properties.description: A 15-year-old Hamilton High School student shot an algebra classmate in the leg during an argument over rap music. The injured student recovered.

properties.title: Mitchell High
properties.description: A 19-year-old senior was shot in his school's gym by a 17-year-old sophomore, following a feud that started off campus earlier in the week; after the shooting, the suspect hands his gun to a coach, saying, "It's over now."

properties.title: Dunbar Elementary
properties.description: Woodrow Porter, 38, who was a janitor at Paul Dunbar Elementary School, was shot to death by the 56-year-old grandmother of an 8-year-old that was allegedly spanked by Porter earlier.

properties.title: J. Leslie Patton Elementary
properties.description: Rosie Pearson, 49, fifth grade teacher, was shot to death in the hallway of J. Leslie Patton School, by an unknown assailant.

properties.title: Valley View High School
properties.description: A 16-year-old stabbed another 16-year-old girl during a fight at

properties.title: Mayde Creek High
properties.description: Mayde Creek High School student Ramesh D. Tumalad, 15, shot himself to death in his Algebra class as his classmates looked on.

properties.title: Whitharral High
properties.description: High School principal M. O. Tripp was shot to death on the front steps of the school by Ricardo Lopez, 17.

properties.title: West High
properties.description: Just after 6:00 A.M. on May 24, 2004, Federico Cervantes-Lavelle shot and killed his estranged wife, Marisela Lavelle, as she arrived at work at West High School in Salt Lake City. Cervantes-Lavelle then committed suicide.

properties.title: King William High
properties.description: 17-year-old Linwood Johnson Regensburg is stabbed to death by 20-year-old Robert Edward Lee at a dance held at King William High School. Neither Regensburg nor Lee were students at the school.

properties.title: Manchester High School
properties.description: Manchester High School stabbing; Victim was stabbed in the band room, suspect arrested.

properties.title: Woodrow Wilson High
properties.description: A 15-year old student at Woodrow Wilson High School who was suspended earlier in the week for disorderly conduct entered the school through the back door and fired three shots in the cafeteria, with two hitting the ceiling and one hitting entering the wall of a classroom. The shooter, identified as 15-year-old Keith Elliott, was charged as an adult with gun violations, armed burglary and assault.

properties.title: Armstrong High
properties.description: Wayne Phillips, 17, was shot to death when he was caught between two youths who were fighting in the hallway of Armstrong High School.

properties.title: Armstrong High
properties.description: A 14-year-old student of Armstrong High School wounded a teacher and a school volunteer.

properties.title: East End Middle
properties.description: A 12-year-old East End Middle School boy shot a girl with his mother's gun.

properties.title: Atlantic Shores Christian School
properties.description: Nicholas Elliott came to Atlantic Shores Christian School armed with a firearm an adult relative purchased for him. He shot two teachers, one fatally, before barging into a portable classroom full of students. The gun jammed and Elliott was tackled. When the teacher that tackled him demanded to know why, he said "They hate me. They make fun of me. They hit me."

properties.title: Essex Elem
properties.description: Christopher A. Williams entered his ex-girlfriend's house and shot her mother dead. Williams then traveled to Essex Elementary School, his ex-girlfriend's workplace, and shot two teachers, killing one. Williams then traveled to a friend's house where he shot and wounded his friend before wounding himself. His ex-girlfriend was not wounded in the attack.

properties.title: Snohomish High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student stabbed two female students with a butcher knife at Snohomish High School. One of the victims was stabbed 20 times, mainly in the heart and lungs, and was critically injured. The victims were both chosen at random, and the victims and suspect did not know each other. The attacker was convicted of attempted murder and was sentenced to 13 years in prison.

properties.title: Lakota High
properties.description: 26-year-old Omero Mendez was sitting in his car parked on the Lakota Middle School campus to wait to pick up his girlfriend's son. There, he was confronted by 16-year-old Luis F. Cosgaya-Alvarez and two of his friends who were inside an SUV. Cosgaya-Alvarez flashed gang signs at Mendez, and then shot Mendez once in the head. Mendez later died of his injuries. Cosgaya-Alvarez was arrested a few days later in Seattle and was charged with murder.

properties.title: Marysville-Pilchuck High School
properties.description: The Marysville Pilchuck High School shooting occurred in Marysville, Washington, on October 24, 2014, when 15-year-old freshman student Jaylen Fryberg shot five other students at Marysville Pilchuck High School, fatally wounding four, before fatally shooting himself.

properties.title: Frontier Middle
properties.description: Barry Loukaitis, 14, killed a teacher and two students and wounded another student at Frontier Middle School when he opened fire on his algebra class. Loukaitis was sentenced to life in prison.

properties.title: Ballard High
properties.description: A gang-related drive-by shooting outside Ballard High School resulted in the death of 16-year-old student Melissa Fernandes and the wounding of 17-year-old student Brent Mason. Police later arrested two men in connection with the shooting.

properties.title: Garfield High
properties.description: A 15-year-old Garfield High School student left school during the day and returned with his grandfather's 9mm semiautomatic handgun. He wounded two students.

properties.title: Whitman Middle
properties.description: 24-year-old Darrell Cloud entered Whitman Middle School and shot his former teacher, 45-year-old Neal Summers, to death. Cloud would serve nine years in prison for the murder. The motive for the shooting was sexual abuse that was alleged to have been perpetrated by Summers against Cloud since Cloud was 13-years-old.

properties.title: Spanaway Jr High
properties.description: Heather Smith fatally shot her ex-boyfriend Gordon Pickett and his friend Chris Ricco as they were leaving wrestling practice at Spanaway Junior High School. Smith committed suicide at the school several hours later during a standoff with sheriff's deputies.

properties.title: Birney Elementary
properties.description: Jennifer Paulson, a 30-year-old special education teacher, is shot to death outside of Birney Elementary School by a man who was reportedly infatuated with her. The gunman, identified as 30-year-old Jed Waits, fled the scene but was later shot and killed by police in a day-care center parking lot.

properties.title: Henry Foss High
properties.description: 18-year-old Douglas S. Chanthabouly shot 17-year-old Samnang Kok to death in the Henry Foss High School hallways due to a personal disagreement. Chathabouly was found guilty of second-degree murder and was sentenced to 23 years of prison.

properties.title: Weston High
properties.description: Eric Hainstock, a 15-year-old student, walked in the school building of Weston High School and shot the high school principal with a handgun after a custodian disarmed him of a shotgun in Cazenovia, Wisconsin. The school principal died, and Hainstock was charged and convicted of murder.

properties.title: Green Bay East High
properties.description: Two 17-year-old boys were arrested the morning of Sept. 14 at Green Bay East High School for allegedly planning an armed attack on their school.

properties.title: Marinette High
properties.description: Samuel Hengel took 23 students and one teacher hostage for over 5 hours at Marinette High School after firing shots at a projector. The suspect, a student in the sophomore Western Civilization class, shot himself after police officers stormed the classroom shortly after 8 p.m. All hostages were removed safely.

properties.title: Wisconsin Lutheran High School
properties.description: A 15-year-old boy, a student

properties.title: Tomah Jr High
properties.description: Principal Martin Mogensen was shot to death in his office by a 14-year-old boy armed with a 20-gauge shotgun.

properties.title: Wauwatosa West High
properties.description: Leonard McDowell, a 21-year-old former student at Wauwatosa West High School, shot Associate Principal Dale Breitlow three times with a .44-cal. Taurus revolver in a second-floor hallway. McDowell was found guilty of the murder and sane at the time of the shooting. His life sentence was upheld by the state Court of Appeals in April, 1997.

properties.title: Kanawha County School Board
properties.description: Angered by a lack of progress, some of the more radical anti-textbook protesters decided to shut down schools by force. On the night of October 9, 1974, dynamite was thrown through the windows of one elementary school. Another school was firebombed and dynamited. Two nights later, protesters threw Molotov cocktails into a school; another school was firebombed a few nights after that. Then, 15 sticks of dynamite were exploded near a gas meter at the board of education office just after a meeting had adjourned. No injuries resulted from any of these incidents, but the level of violence and destruction shook the community.

properties.title: Morgantown High School
properties.description: According to police and witnesses, a 14-year-old student stabbed a 17-year-old student at

properties.title: Hayes Jr High
properties.description: A 15-year-old student was shot and killed by another student at Hayes Junior High School.

properties.title: Cokeville Elementary
properties.description: David Young, and his wife Doris Young, took 167 children and adults hostage at Cokeville Elementary School. After a two-and-a-half hour standoff, a gasoline bomb the couple was carrying went off prematurely, injuring Doris Young while David Young was out of the room. Returning to the scene, David Young shot his wife, and then himself. All the hostages escaped, though 79 were later hospitalized with burns and injuries.

properties.title: Central Middle
properties.description: 4 students of a physical education class were wounded at Central Middle School in Sheridan, Wyoming, when 29-year-old Kevin Newman fired at them with a handgun. He then committed suicide by shooting himself in the head. A suicide note found in Newman's motel room revealed that he was unhappy with his life and thought of himself as an evil person.

properties.title: 2013 Alabama Bunker Hostage Crisis
properties.description: On January 29, 2013, a hostage crisis, lasting almost seven days, began in the Wiregrass Region near U.S. Highway 231 in Midland City, Alabama. Jimmy Lee Dykes, a 65-year-old Vietnam War-era veteran boarded a Dale County school bus, killed the driver, and took a five-year-old boy hostage. On the afternoon of Monday, February 4, law enforcement agents entered the bunker, killed Dykes, and rescued the child hostage.

properties.title: Midland City School Bus
properties.description: A gunman, a man in his 60s, boarded a school bus and shot & killed the bus driver, Charles Albert Poland Jr., 66. The gunman abducted a 5-year-old child from the bus and held him hostage in an underground bunker for almost 7 days. The gunman was shot to death by police.

properties.title: PINEWOOD ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
properties.description: A man with a knife hijacked a school bus in Jacksonville, taking 11 Pinewood Elementary School students and their bus driver on a detour that police ended in Cabot after a 10-mile chase. Police stopped the hijacking 20 minutes after it began. The suspect, 22-year-old Nicholas John Miller, was charged with a felony count of vehicle piracy, 12 felony counts of kidnapping, and two felony counts of aggravated assault.

properties.title: Parkway Academy Central
properties.description: A student was beaten on a school bus that was heading to students' homes from Parkway Academy Central. The beating was recorded and appeared on social media websites. Five students were charged with third-degree assault and third-degree conspiracy in connection with the attack. The victim did not suffer serious injuries.

properties.title: University High
properties.description: 17-year-old Kelvin De La Cruz stabbed 15-year-old Michael Nieves in the chest with a pocket knife at a school bus stop of the Main Campus at University High School. After he stabbed him, Cruz hid under the bus and attempted to change his clothes, but was apprehended and charged with first-degree murder. Nieves died two hours after being stabbed.

properties.title: Wauseon School  Bus
properties.description: Karen A. Smith, a 12-year-old junior high school student, is stabbed to death on a school bus. The assailant, identified as 14-year-old Douglas Konrath, fled the school bus but was arrested when he returned to the scene and attacked a deputy.

properties.title: Stewart County School System
properties.description: 14-year old Jason Clinard shot and killed school bus driver Joyce Gregory, who had been carrying a bus of approximately 24 students.

properties.title: Dallas High
properties.description: 16-year-old Cody Cobbins died after the older brother of a 17-year-old boy that Cobbins was arguing over a bus seat with fatally shot him.
